article: 8 Easy Solutions to Fix Airpods Not Connecting to iPhone

steps.title: Make sure your iPhone or iPad is updated.
steps.subtitle: Software updates include the latest bug fixes, so be sure your device is up-to-date. Do the following:

points.name: Select the AirPods as your audio device.

steps.subtitle: Put the AirPods back in the charging case and close the lid. Wait 30 seconds, and then put them in your ear. Check if they're connected to your device.
sub-points: If the AirPods still aren't connected, put them back in the case, but leave the lid open. Press and hold the button on the back of the case for 15 seconds. The light indicator should turn amber and then white.

steps.title: If the AirPods still won't connect,  for help.
steps.subtitle: This may be a hardware issue, and you may still be covered by Apple's warranty.
sub-points: You can contact Apple on their website at .
